title: Cisgender
summary: Cisgender (sometimes cissexual, or shortened to cis) describes a person whose gender identity is the same as their sex assigned at birth.[1] The word cisgender is the antonym of  transgender.[2][3] The prefix cis- is not an acronym or abbreviation of another word; it is derived from Latin meaning on this side of. Coined in 1994, cisgender began to be added to dictionaries in 2015, as a result of changes in the way people discussed gender.[4][5]
